text: Downward movement may in some forms start as a passive sinking, especially when it occurs before dawn; but this must almost certainly be replaced by the headfirst downward swimming observed in the field. 3. Initiating, controlling, and orienting factors. The primary dependence of diurnal migrations upon changes in light intensity is beyond doubt. Yet in spite of a great amount of work, the detailed causal relationship remains one of confused complexity.
